POW.name: POW:
POW.hint: Global staking, mining pools and validator statistics

Header.Search for a validator, pool, tx, addres: Search for a validator, pool, tx, address, network, etc

search.noResults: No results found, try to search for something else

Navbar.mobile description: Anon, please note that my mobile version has limited features. To enjoy all of my perks, and to login into your account, please visit my desktop version.

HomePage.title: Web3 Blockchain Validator and Mining Pool Explorer
HomePage.description: My landing page is your one-stop explorer for comparing top validators across multiple web3 blockchain networks. The table provides real-time data on validator and mining pool performance, summarized into easy to read metrics. You can sort and filter based on what matters most to you. The goal is to help you make smart staking choices by providing a clear and user-friendly overview of validator profiles across web3. The table is loaded randomly every time you visit the page. To create a permanent view, you need to connect your wallet and create a favorite list.

Battery.name: Battery
Battery.hint: General health status, encomprasses on-chain off-chain verifiable validator actions and social networks

Technical.name: Technical
Technical.hint: Offering robust network security and additional infrastructure increases the score

Social.name: Social
Social.hint: A strong digital presence and numerous on-chain fans raise the score

Governance.name: Governance
Governance.hint: Participation in keychain life events and initiative boost the score

User.name: User
User.hint: On-chain user-validator interactions, like reviews, elevate the score

TVS.name: TVS
TVS.hint: Total Secured Value. Total amount of assets staked to validator

Table.Click 3 times to reset all filters: Click 3 times to reset all filters

Metadata.title: Global Web3 Statistics: Explore the Multichain Landscape

GlobalPosPage.title: Global Web3 Statistics: Explore the Multichain Landscape
GlobalPosPage.description: Explore my Global Blockchain Statistics page for a comprehensive overview of the web3 landscape, featuring stats of web3 security, decentralization and scalability status. Discover trends in staking dominance, rewards and crypto capitalization through interactive charts and graphs, and use these insights to inform your staking decisions and crypto portfolio growth, making it a valuable resource for web3 exploration and analytics that you can also discuss with others in the P2P Chat.

CalculatorPage.title: Staking and Mining Rewards Calculator
CalculatorPage.description: I've created a Reward Calculator Tool to help you estimate your potential staking rewards for proof of stake (PoS) and proof of work (PoW) tokens. Simply pick a blockchain network, select a validator, and enter your stake amount to see your estimated daily, weekly, monthly, or yearly rewards. My reward calculator is unique and different from others. Apart from APR, APY and commissions, my calculation include such parameters as: slashing events, jail time, additional provider revenue, and so on.

NetworksPage.title: Network A-Z Directory: Discover Blockchain Networks and their Valuation
NetworksPage.description: I’ve created this Network A-Z Directory to showcase blockchain networks, including key statistics like fully diluted valuation, important links and token symbol. This list is perfect for developers, stakers, and multichain explorers, allowing you to find networks that match your interests and then study their profiles to explore staking potential. With direct links you'll get a clear snapshot of each chain, helping you navigate the web3 landscape and make informed decisions.

NetworkProfileHeader.description: Build a blockchain using the best-in-class open source libraries and services.
NetworkProfileHeader.temperature tooltip: Shows the chain health status based on various verifiable metrics
NetworkProfileHeader.tvl tooltip: Total value of assets locked on chain, not including inflation / home assets
NetworkProfileHeader.revenue tooltip: The amount of fees generated by network yesterday
NetworkProfileHeader.validator cost tooltip: The value in USD it would cost to get a node to produce rewards
NetworkProfileHeader.mau tooltip: The value in USD it would cost to get a node to produce rewards

NetworkPassport.title: Blockchain Network Overview: A Web3 Starting Point
NetworkPassport.description: I’ve crafted this Overview tab to give you the lowdown on this blockchain network—its mission, its health status, APR, TVL and more. Whether you’re new to decentralized networks or a pro, this is your gateway to understanding it the decentralization, scalability and security level of this network. Want more? Dive into the other tabs or check out our Ecosystem A-Z Directory!
NetworkPassport.% of comm pool to total supply: % of Comm Pool to Total Supply

NetworkStatistics.title: Blockchain Statistics Dashboard: Live Network Metrics
NetworkStatistics.description: Numbers time! The Statistics tab delivers live blockchain metrics—total value staked, transaction volume, healthy validators, operator distribution, all with slick charts. Perfect for tracking network health or digging into web3 data trends. Want the big picture? Compare it with our Global Blockchain Stats!

NetworkGovernance.title: Governance Portal: Network Voting
NetworkGovernance.description: The Governance tab uncovers how this network’s decentralized governance works—active proposals, proposal voting records, delegator votes, and community input. It’s all about seeing the blockchain’s decision-making in action. Ready to join in? Explore our Validator A-Z List to meet the key players!
NetworkGovernance.total tooltip: The combined amount of the proposals the network had, including failed, live, etc

NetworkDevInfo.title: Developer Activity: Web3 Contributors
NetworkDevInfo.description: The Dev Info tab shines a light on the developer activity powering this blockchain. I’ve pulled details on the contributors—how many coders are active, what decentralized apps they’re building, and the consensus details.
NetworkDevInfo.pre vote synchronized: Validator has submitted pre-vote with synchronized block hash
NetworkDevInfo.pre vote different: Validator has submitted pre-vote with different block hash
NetworkDevInfo.pre vote not submitted: Validator has not submitted pre-vote yet
NetworkDevInfo.pre commit synchronized: Validator has submitted pre-commit with synchronized block hash
NetworkDevInfo.pre commit different: Validator has submitted pre-commit with different block hash
NetworkDevInfo.pre commit not submitted: Validator has not submitted pre-commit yet

NetworkTokenomics.title: Tokenomics: Analysis of the Network’s Crypto Economy
NetworkTokenomics.description: Let’s dive into tokens! The Tokenomics tab breaks down this network’s crypto economy—think token staking rewards, supply stats, distribution details and Gini Coefficient. Slick charts to show Revenue flows and Capital moves in real time. Need a deeper look? Pair it with our Staking Reward Calculator!

NetworkValidatorsPage.title: Blockchain Validator Summary
NetworkValidatorsPage.description: The Validator Summary Table gives you a clear, at-a-glance view of all the validators securing {networkName}. Packed with key network staking stats—like total value staked, commission rates, uptime, and governance participation—this table makes it easy to compare and pick your favorites. Whether you’re a delegator looking to optimize staking rewards or just curious about blockchain validator performance, you’ll find everything you need right here. Sort, filter, and dive into each validator’s profile for more details—let’s find the perfect match for your web3 journey!

Expected APR.name: Expected APR
Expected APR.hint: This is the yearly return on your stake in percentage, if were to be calculated right now. It's expected, because inflation, comission, etc - can change at any moment

Voting Power.name: Voting Power
Voting Power.hint: The total amount secured with the validator, and the amount it represents in % out of the total amount of staked tokens

Commission.name: Commission
Commission.hint: The % from the rewards generated that the validator receives for securing the network

Self Delegation.name: Self Delegation
Self Delegation.hint: The amount of tokens the validator staked to their own node from the operator account. The color indicates the ratio in comparison to other nodes on the network

Uptime.name: Uptime
Uptime.hint: The amount of time the node is online over a selected period of time. The color indicates the ratio in comparison to other nodes on the network

Missed Blocks.name: Missed Blocks
Missed Blocks.hint: The amount of total missed blocks by this validator since the start of the node. The color indicates the ratio in comparison to other nodes on the network

Infrastructure.name: Infrastructure
Infrastructure.hint: Does this validator provide public infrastructure for this network? RPC, Archive, etc. Click on the V to see details

Governance.name: Governance
Governance.hint: Governance score of the validator out of a 100. Based on their participation in key life events

Table.Click 3 times to reset all filters: Click 3 times to reset all filters

NodesPage.title: Nodes A-Z Directory: Explore Nodes with Staking Data
NodesPage.description: Welcome to the Nodes A-Z Directory, a comprehensive list of nodes from various blockchain validators, featuring basic performance data, such as stake size and ecosystem. This directory is your one-stop shop for understanding the infrastructure behind the networks, allowing you to search for a specific node or browse the list to learn more. It is often, that validator nodes are mixed with validator profiles. No more. Making it valuable for both techies and stakers, and can be used for a broader understanding of the web3 space.

EcosystemsPage.title: Ecosystem A-Z Directory: Explore Web3 Projects
EcosystemsPage.description: The Ecosystem A-Z Directory is your gateway to web3, featuring a list of projects and communities, including decentralized apps and governance platforms, with additional information like revenue and projects included in that ecosystem. This directory helps you discover new projects, with stats highlighting each project's momentum and influence, and you can use it to find your next favorite project, then join our P2P Chat to discuss and share ideas with other web3 enthusiasts, connecting you to the people and platforms shaping the future of web3.

MAA.name: M.A.A.
MAA.hint: Amount of monthly active accounts in chain

RumorsPage.title: P2P Chat: Connect with Web3 Stakers and Miners
RumorsPage.description: Join our anon P2P Chat, a secure and easy-to-use hub for web3 enthusiasts to discuss blockchain networks, mining pools, and validator rumors. Connect with other delegators and miners, share insights on staking strategies and crypto education, or simply - chat. It’s your go-to for staking and mining resources, where you can ask "who to stake with" and get answers from people who’ve been there.

MetricsPage.title: Metric A-Z Glossary: Understand Key Web3 Metrics
MetricsPage.description: I’ve created the Metric A-Z Glossary to explain essential web3 metrics, from Annual Percentage Yield to Validator Uptime, covering what each means, why it's important, and how it's calculated. This glossary is designed for both newcomers and experienced users, helping you understand the numbers and make informed decisions. Use it to get up to speed before exploring tools like the Compare Validators Tool or Global Space Statistics page, and consider it your cheat sheet for smarter web3 decisions, making it easier to navigate and master the data driving validatorinfo.com

AIPage.title: AI-Powered Web3 Validator Search: Tailored Results for Unique Criteria
AIPage.description: Welcome to our AI Search page—your personal web3 detective. This tool handles specific validator and mining pool queries, like finding validators with certain commission rates, network support, or political leanings. Our AI delivers precise, actionable results in seconds, making your search fast and efficient. Whether you're a staking newbie or pro, I’m here to help. Ready to see what I can do? Enter your criteria and watch the magic unfold!

ValidatorsPage.title: Validator A-Z Directory: Comprehensive List with Social Links
ValidatorsPage.description: I’ve put together this Validator A-Z Directory to give you a full rundown of validators across various blockchain networks, including their key links. This directory allows you to search for a specific validator by customizing the search by network stage, set position or node status. You can use the Compare Validators Tool for side-by-side analysis to make smart staking choices, with real-time information on governance participation and performance stats all in one spot.

Metadata.title: Compare Blockchain Validators and Mining Pools

ComparisonPage.title: Compare Blockchain Validators and Mining Pools
ComparisonPage.description: I built the Compare Validators Tool to help you decide who to stake with. It lets you compare multiple validators side-by-side, with metrics like staking rewards, performance, and health status. Choose your validators and I'll create a comparison table with key details, including visuals to highlight standouts. This helps you make an informed decision and find which provider shows better metrics over time. My tools provide a picture in real time. The comparison of provider A vs B, might show different results, when performed over or at different times, depending on the health status of the providers themselves in a given moment.
ComparisonPage.descriptionExtended:
Do remember one thing anon. My tools provide a picture in real time. The comparison of provider A vs B, might show different results, when performed over or at different times, depending on the health status of the providers themselves in a given moment.

My tools are experimental, so please use me at your own risk. If you like what you see, please share it with the rest of the world.

ProfilePage.title: Welcome
ProfilePage.description:
What is Lorem Ipsum?
Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged.

Metadata.title: About Validator Info: Your Guide to Web3 Validators and Mining Pools

Contacts.title: Validator Info Contacts
Contacts.description: I’d love to hear from you! Whether you’ve got questions about validator information, want to explore staking with Citizen Web3, or have ideas for the podcast, this is your spot to connect. Fill out the form below, ping me on X, or check out our GitHub—I’m just a message away. Your feedback fuels our growth, so don’t hold back. Let’s team up to make web3 even better!

AboutPage.description:
I’m Validator Info, brought to life by the <citizenLink>Citizen Web3</citizenLink> team. I’m a multichain, validator-focused explorer and aggregator for various networks thriving in web3. Whether it’s Proof of Work or Proof of Stake chains, I’ve got the details you need about validators, mining pools, and the networks themselves.

My goal? To empower you with the best validator information and mining pool data so you can navigate the web3 space with confidence. I’m here to simplify your web3 journey. With real-time metrics and an easy-to-use interface, I help you find the validator or mining pool that fits your needs.

I’m still a work in progress, and I’d love your input as I grow. Follow me <xLink>on X</xLink>, explore my <ghLink>GitHub repos</ghLink>, or drop me a comment with your ideas—I’m all ears! Together, we can make this a go-to resource for web3 enthusiasts like you.

Citizen Web3 is an active member of the web3 galaxy. <stakingLink>Staking with our self-hosted</stakingLink> baremetal infrastructure allows CW3 to work on various public good projects and contribute to the development of web3.
AboutPage.title: About Validator Info: Your Guide to Web3 Validators and Mining Pools
Tools: <link>Citizen Web3 Podcast</link>: Discovering Web3 Contributors to Blockchain Decentralization, Network Security and App Scalability
<link>Web3 Society</link>: Web3 Community Based on Values of Decentralization. Learning to Forget Tribalism and Love the Tech. Future DAO
<link>Validator Infra</link>: Self-Hosted, Bare-Metal Validator Infrastructure. Off the Grid Capacity. Offering Endpoints, Archive, Snapshots and Relaying
<link>B.V.C.</link>: Baremetal Valdiator Coven. Community of Selfhosted and Baremetal Blockcahin Network Operators
(NA at the moment) Bazaar: NFTs, Merchandise, Decentraland
AboutPage.Manifesto:
From this distant vantage point, the Earth might not seem of any particular interest. But for us, it's different. Consider again at that dot. That's here. That's home. That's us. On it everyone you love, everyone you know, everyone you ever heard of, every human being who ever was, lived out their lives. The aggregate of our joy and suffering, thousands of confident religions, ideologies, and economic doctrines, every hunter and forager, every hero and coward, every creator and destroyer of civilization, every king and peasant, every young couple in love, every mother and father, hopeful child, inventor and explorer, every teacher of morals, every corrupt politician, every "superstar," every "supreme leader," every saint and sinner in the history of our species lived there--on a mote of dust suspended in a sunbeam... Our posturings, our imagined self-importance, the delusion that we have some privileged position in the Universe, are challenged by this point of pale light. Our planet is a lonely speck in the great enveloping cosmic dark. In our obscurity, in all this vastness, there is no hint that help will come from elsewhere to save us from ourselves...

From 'A Pale Blue Dot', by Carl Sagan.


We believe in freedom above needs. We believe in possibilities above enforcement. We believe in values above desires. We believe that censorship has killed more people than anything else together combined. We value honesty and we value the truth. We value love and cherish all existing creatures. We value intelligence and we value decentralization.

We believe in communication, which allows participants to think, make their mind up and cast personal votes on any topic and subject. We think that content should strive to lack subjective opinions and help its consumers to form an opinion, which will result in better discussion, and in turn in a more efficient consensus.

We believe that blockchains are not simply a form of digital nations. But, open and verifiable blockchains are somewhat similar to natural hives, forests, patterns in the nature that allow us to communicate better. Without communication, we are doomed, and decentralized consensus is a tool that can and will help those who desire to make our pale blue dot a slightly better place.

AND MAY THE CODE BE WITH YOU!

Podcast.title: Citizen Web3 Podcast: Conversations with those that Build Web3
Podcast.description: Welcome to the Citizen Web3 Podcast! We interview the builders, thinkers, and visionaries driving the decentralized future, covering validator insights, staking tips, and big ideas in web3. Whether you’re a staking pro or just starting out, there’s something here to spark your curiosity. Check out our latest episodes and subscribe to stay updated.
Podcast.SubscribeOtherHint: You can also subscribe with your favorite app directly, using the buttons below
Podcast.spreadText: Every sharing helps to spread web3 values across the universe!

Staking.title: Staking with Citizen Web3: Secure, Reliable, and Value-Focused
Staking.description: At Citizen Web3, we offer secure staking across multiple blockchain networks, using self-hosted, baremetal infrastructure. By staking with us, you're supporting a team that values decentralization, transparency, and community, and contributing to the public good. We prioritize reliability and openness, ensuring your stake is secure and impactful. Check out our staking options and start earning rewards.

Partners.title: Partners of Citizen Web3: Collaborating for a Better Web3
Partners.description: At Citizen Web3, we partner with innovative projects to deliver top-notch validator information and staking solutions, making web3 more transparent and accessible. Check out our partners, each bringing unique expertise, and reach out via our contact page to discuss potential collaborations.

ValidatorProfileHeader.description: Embracing Decentralization, Empowering Communities. The Voice of Web3 & Non-custodial staking service.

ValidatorNetworksPage.title: Validator Profile: Supported Networks
ValidatorNetworksPage.description: The Networks tab provides a comprehensive view of all the blockchain networks supported by this validator, featuring a table with key stats like expected APR, commissions, total value secured, uptime, and active delegators. This is ideal for stakers looking for the best network or those curious about the validator's reach, allowing you to compare performance across chains and choose the best spot for your staking goals. For more detailed information, check out our Network A-Z Directory. These stats are crucial for understanding the validator's performance across ecosystems, helping you make informed decisions in the multichain world.

Network.name: Network
Network.hint: You can narrow down the Network list by using the customize filter on the left. The green square indicates the status of the node. If the square is red, the node is jailed

Expected APR.name: Expected APR
Expected APR.hint: This is the yearly return on your stake in percentage, if were to be calculated right now. It's expected, because inflation, comission, etc - can change at any moment

Fans.name: Fans
Fans.hint: Amount of accounts delegating to this validator

Rank.name: Rank
Rank.hint: Their rank in the active set, based on the amount of voting power

Voting Power.name: Voting Power
Voting Power.hint: The total amount secured with the validator, and the amount it represents in % out of the total amount of staked tokens

Commission.name: Commission
Commission.hint: The % from the rewards generated that the validator receives for securing the network

Self Delegation.name: Self Delegation
Self Delegation.hint: The amount of tokens the validator staked to their own node from the operator account. The color indicates the ratio in comparison to other nodes on the network

Uptime.name: Uptime
Uptime.hint: The amount of time the node is online over a selected period of time. The color indicates the ratio in comparison to other nodes on the network

Missed Blocks.name: Missed Blocks
Missed Blocks.hint: The amount of total missed blocks by this validator since the start of the node. The color indicates the ratio in comparison to other nodes on the network

Infrastructure.name: Infrastructure
Infrastructure.hint: Does this validator provide public infrastructure for this network? RPC, Archive, etc. Click on the V to see details

Governance.name: Governance
Governance.hint: Governance score of the validator out of a 100. Based on their participation in key life events

Table.Click 3 times to reset all filters: Click 3 times to reset all filters

ValidatorMetricsPage.title: Validator Profile: Scores and Vanity Metrics
ValidatorMetricsPage.description: The Metrics tab offers detailed performance data for this validator, including governance, technical, social and user scores and total value secured. Presented with real-time updates and clear charts. This makes it easy to assess reliability and efficiency, aiding in confident staking decisions. Pair this with our Reward Calculator Tool to see how these numbers impact your earnings.
ValidatorMetricsPage.tvs tooltip: Total amount of assets staked with the validator across all known networks
ValidatorMetricsPage.fans tooltip: Total amount of delegators to this validator across all known networks

ValidatorRevenuePage.title: Validator Profile: Reward Revenue
ValidatorRevenuePage.description: The Revenue tab details how much this validator earns and what it means for your staking rewards. This provides a full financial picture, helping you understand the validator's health and your potential returns. Including past slashing events and possible own tokens. This information shows how the validator's revenue model ties into your earnings, allowing you to choose a validator that fits your goals.
ValidatorRevenuePage.tooltip global revenue: The revenue generated by commission from all of the validator networks
ValidatorRevenuePage.tooltip rewards generated: This chart shows the total amount of rewards this validator paid out on any particular day, week, month or year in USD across all known networks. Calculated from staking, mining and rewards from own tokens

ValidatorGovernancePage.title: Validator Profile: Governance Summary Feed
ValidatorGovernancePage.description: The Governance tab tracks this validator's activity in shaping their networks, logging their votes on proposals and any they’ve submitted, demonstrating their influence and dedication. This goes beyond staking, as it's about steering the chain's future. For specifics on proposals, check out our Network A-Z Directory. Their role in network decisions can affect protocol upgrades and reward structures, which directly impact you.
ValidatorGovernancePage.tooltip created proposals: Shows a summary of validator created proposals, the description, and their result across all known networks. Green means proposal was accepted
ValidatorGovernancePage.tooltip news feed: Summary of the voting activity of the validator across all networks. Click the proposal ID for more detail

ValidatorPublicGoodsPage.title: Validator Profile: Public Good Projects. Infrastructure, Community, Tools and Others
ValidatorPublicGoodsPage.description: The Projects tab showcases how this validator gives back, listing initiatives like running infrastructure, funding open-source tools, or educational efforts, along with details on their impact. This allows you to support a validator whose values align with yours, contributing to a stronger, decentralized web3. These projects highlight their commitment, making staking with them feel rewarding as you know they’re making a difference.

PublicGoodsToolsPage.description: Submit here any explorers, wallets, dashboards, staking interfaces and similar tools operators create.

PublicGoodsInfrastructurePage.description: Validators run a lot of infrastructure. This info is verified automatically and doesn't need submitting. Although validator does NOT equal node, all validator nodes are public goods and run by the same entity. Hence, they are listed as entity goods, rather than network specific goods.

PublicGoodsMediaPage.description: Please submit known media projects run, sponsored or hosted by the validator. Podcasts, YouTube channels, blogs... Projects should contain an audience to fall under this category.
PublicGoodsMediaPage.tooltip: Click to approve or disapprove this information

PublicGoodsCommunityPage.description: Please submit links to validator created public events, administered chats and communities, twitter spaces and other similar online lives. Documentation, videos, 1 off blog posts, artistic contributions, stickers, forum participation, etc - are all examples of community contributions.

ValidatorPassportPage.title: Validator Node Passport
ValidatorPassportPage.description: This tab serves as your node’s personal ID card, providing essential details like the network it operates on, its operator address, and unique identifiers. Whether you’re a node operator or just exploring, this is your starting point to verify and understand the node. Knowing these details helps you track performance and confirm alignment with your staking or monitoring goals, serving as the foundation for further exploration.

VotingSummaryPage.description: The Votes tab shows how this node engages with network governance, listing every proposal it has voted on and its stance on each. This reveals the node's influence on the network’s direction. You can compare its voting habits with other nodes. A node that votes actively signals its dedication to the network, which could sway your decision on who to stake with.

Type.name: Type
Type.hint: Types of proposals depend on the network. They can indicate changes to the code, sentiment-type questions, fund requests and so on. Check out our Metrics section to learn more

TxSummaryPage.description: The Transactions tab tracks every action this node takes on the network, including staking moves and reward payouts, all logged with timestamps and specifics. It’s ideal for monitoring the node’s activity and spotting behavior trends, ensuring it’s running smoothly. Monitoring these logs helps you check the node’s health and reliability, which is crucial for making smart staking choices.

Timestamp.name: Timestamp
Timestamp.hint: Time and date the transaction took place in UTC

Block Height.name: Block Height
Block Height.hint: The number of block the transaction took place

RichListPage.description: This tab shows power events and node delegators. It highlight significant moments like major delegations or shifts in the validator set. This gives you an insider peek at the node’s clout and potential impact on the network’s balance of power. Seeing the node’s position helps you judge its stability and growth potential, which is super handy for long-term planning.

NodeRevenuePage.description: The Revenue tab reveals how much you can earn with this node over time. This gives you a clear picture of its financial performance, helping you determine if it’s profitable and how it could boost your staking returns. A node’s revenue shows its efficiency and success against the network itself, key information whether you’re staking now or planning ahead.

TotalTxsPage.title: Blockchain: Transaction Activity
TotalTxsPage.description: I’ve put together this Transaction Summary Table to give you a quick, clear view of what’s happening across the network. It’s packed with real-time data on transaction volume, average fees, tps and the total number of transactions. Want to dig deeper? Just click any transaction to see its full details!

Timestamp.name: Timestamp
Timestamp.hint: Time and date the transaction took place in UTC

Block Height.name: Block Height
Block Height.hint: The number of block the transaction took place

TxInformationPage.title: Blockchain Transaction Details: In-Depth Information of the Transaction
TxInformationPage.description: The Transaction Details page is laid out with everything you need to know about this specific transaction—its unique hash, JSON data, sender and receiver addresses, amount transferred, status, timestamp, and fees. It’s like a detailed receipt for your blockchain activity, giving you full transparency and peace of mind. Need to explore more? Check out our Transaction History Explorer for advanced insights!

ProposalPage.title: Governance Proposal
ProposalPage.description: All the key details of this blockchain governance proposal you need. This page delivers real-time voting stats—yes, no, abstain, and veto percentages—plus validator votes to show who’s driving the decision. Our AI summary breaks down the proposal’s essentials for quick understanding, while links to the full text and forums offer deeper exploration. Check the timestamp to stay on top of the voting deadline and make your voice heard!
ProposalPage.Search by validator name and tx hash: Search by validator name and tx hash

LibraryPage.title: Gamified Learning Library: Choose Your Web3 Journey
LibraryPage.description: Welcome to the Gamified Learning Library, your knowledge aggregator for mastering web3! This is where your adventure begins—choose your path from the next four tabs: Developer, Validator, Delegator, or Curious. Each path offers tailored resources to boost your skills, and as you complete readings, you’ll answer questions to earn internal points. It’s a fun, interactive way to explore the world of blockchain and level up your expertise. Pick your path and let’s get started!

Validators.title: Validator and Miner Resources: Secure Networks and Earn Rewards
Validators.description: Validators and Miners, this one’s for you! The Validator and Miner Resources tab offers filtered links to guides on network security, staking rewards, mining materials and governance participation. As you read through, you’ll answer questions to earn internal points, sharpening your skills while contributing to blockchain networks. It’s the perfect spot to deepen your expertise and maximize your impact. Check out the resources and take your game to the next level!

Developers.title: Developer Hub: Blockchain Coding and Smart Contract Resources
Developers.description: The Developer Hub is built for coders ready to dive into blockchain development! Here, you’ll find filtered links to resources on smart contracts, coding tutorials, and decentralized app creation. After each reading, you’ll tackle questions to earn internal points, making learning both rewarding and engaging. Whether you’re a beginner or a seasoned dev, this tab has everything you need to build the future of web3. Start exploring now!

Delegators.title: Delegator Guide: Optimize Staking or Mining and Select Top Validators and Pools
Delegators.description: Delegators, welcome to your go-to resource hub! The Delegator Guide provides filtered links to info on staking strategies, validator selection, and reward optimization. After each reading, you’ll answer questions to earn internal points, helping you become a staking pro. Whether you’re new to delegating or refining your approach, this tab has the tools you need to succeed. Start exploring and boost your staking rewards today!

Curious.title: Curious Explorer: Learn Blockchain Basics and Web3 Essentials
Curious.description: New to web3 or just curious? The Curious Explorer tab is your starting line! Discover filtered links to resources on blockchain basics, crypto education, and decentralized applications. As you read, you’ll answer questions to earn internal points, turning your curiosity into knowledge the gamified way. It’s a fun, approachable entry into the world of web3—jump in and see where your journey takes you!

LibraryPage.how to run a node on cosmos: How to run a node on Cosmos

Passport.title: Blockchain Account Passport: Essential Overview
Passport.description: Welcome to the account passport! I’ve gathered the key details about this blockchain address— unique identifier, join date, account value and delegations snapshot. It’s a quick reference for all things account-related, giving a clear starting point to explore web3.

Governance.title: Governance Participation: Votes and Network Impact

Analytics.title: Account Analytics Dashboard: Insights into Blockchain Activity
